alert.note: Alert for Camden; Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 6:04PM EDT until July 29 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Camden County in northeastern North Carolina... Currituck County in northeastern North Carolina... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 604 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Back Bay to Indiantown, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Knotts Island around 615 PM EDT. Grandy around 635 PM EDT. Corolla around 640 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Belcross, Poplar Branch, Aydlett, Gregory, Jarvisburg, Barco, Coinjock, Riddle, Waterlily and Bertha. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
